plentry.pd: Number of audio streams to be mixed locally.
Audio sources to be mixed locally. See .

Whether the mixed audio stream uses the timestamp of audio frames captured by the local microphone:
: (default) Use the timestamp of audio frames captured by the local mic. Set this value if you want all locally captured audio streams to stay synchronized.
: Do not use the local mic timestamp. The SDK uses the timestamp when the mixed audio frame is constructed.
Number of audio streams to be mixed locally.
Audio sources to be mixed locally. See .

Whether the mixed audio stream uses the timestamp of audio frames captured by the local microphone:
: (Default) Uses the timestamp of audio frames captured by the local microphone. Set this value if you want all locally captured audio streams to stay synchronized.
: Does not use the timestamp of audio frames captured by the local microphone. The SDK uses the timestamp when the mixed audio frame is constructed.
Number of audio streams to be mixed locally.
Audio sources to be mixed locally. See MixedAudioStream.

Whether the mixed audio stream uses timestamps from the local microphone audio frames:
: (default) Uses timestamps from the local microphone audio frames. Set this value if you want all locally captured audio streams to stay synchronized.
: Does not use timestamps from the local microphone audio frames. The SDK uses the timestamp when the mixed audio frame is constructed.
Number of audio streams to be mixed locally.
Audio sources to be mixed locally. See MixedAudioStream.

Whether the mixed audio stream uses the timestamp of audio frames captured by the local microphone:
: (default) Uses the timestamp of audio frames captured by the local microphone. Set this value if you want all locally captured audio streams to stay synchronized.
: Does not use the timestamp of audio frames captured by the local microphone. The SDK uses the timestamp when the mixed audio frame is constructed.
